Order Denying [61-1] Motion For Omnibus Order Authorizing Trustee's Operations of Bank of New England Corporation and Its Numerous Subsidiaries. Pursuant to 11 U.S.C. 721 and Setting Guidelines For Compensation of Trustee and Professional Persons. by Ben S. Branch . The Motion is denied without prejudice and be refiled with notice to all creditors and to the United States Trustee. If the Trustee renews his motion with respect to indemnification, he should reflect the request for indemnification in the caption of the motion and should state in the motion why indemnification is justified and what the indemnification would cover. (CJK) Entered on 4.26.91 (mkp) (Entered: 04/30/1991)

Hillman, J. - Order Regarding [608-1] Order Regarding [581-1] Notice Sale Of Property Of The Estate (Leveraged Lease Portfolio) Outside The Ordinary Course Of Business by Dr. Ben Branch . The Court will consider the two proposed orders submitted by the Trustee as motions to reconsider/alter/amend judgment under FRCP 59(e). The Court will conduct a hearing on 1/18/94 at 10:00 a.m. on the proposed orders and the objections thereto. First Union's Notice of Appeal will not take effect until the disposition of the Trustee's motion to alter/amend. Entered on 1/10/94 (jmd) (Entered: 01/11/1994)
